text: The Redmi K80 series is official and the Xiaomi sub-brand also announced a new smartwatch and TWS buds alongside its latest and greatest smartphones. Redmi Watch 5 Redmi Watch 5 is the logical successor to last year’s Redmi Watch 4 and it brings a larger 2.07-inch AMOLED screen which now peaks at 1,500 nits. Xiaomi also trimmed the bezels and kept the 60Hz refresh rate. Redmi Watch 5 key specs Watch 5 features an aluminum frame and a metal dial on the right-hand side which allows you to navigate the UI. It’s one of the first wearables to launch with Xiaomi HyperOS 2 out of the box. Xiaomi is also offering an eSIM version, which allows you to make calls and send out messages on supported platforms. Xiaomi claims its new heart-rate tracking sensor offers 97.1% accuracy and you also get the standard blood oxygen, sleep and stress tracking. The watch also features a built-in GNSS positioning sensor and tracks your usual sports and activities. Redmi Watch 5 eSIM edition 550mAh battery inside the Watch 5 is now rated at up to 24 days of normal usage and up to 12 days with Always-On Display mode. Redmi Watch 5 comes in black and silver colors and is priced at CNY 599 ($82). The eSIM version comes in Titanium silver and is priced at CNY 799 ($110). Redmi Buds 6 Pro Redmi Buds 6 Pro come with 11 mm titanium-coated dynamic drivers which are paired with 6.7mm piezoelectric ceramic drivers. Xiaomi also updated the active noise cancelation (ANC) which can drown out up to 55dB of noise. Buds 6 Pro pair over Bluetooth 5.3 and support LHDC 5.0 and LC3 audio codecs. Battery life from the buds and their case is rated at up to 36 hours. Redmi Buds 6 Pro and Buds 6 Pro Gaming Edition Xiaomi is also offering a Gaming Edition Buds 6 Pro, which features a 20ms latency and supports the LHDC Lossless audio codec via its specialized USB-C adapter. Redmi Buds 6 Pro come in Jade Green, White and Black colors. Pricing is set at CNY 399 ($55). Buds 6 Pro Gaming Edition are priced at CNY 499 ($68). Redmi Watch 5 • Redmi Buds 6 Pro (both in Chinese)
html:
The Redmi K80 series is official and the Xiaomi sub-brand also announced a new smartwatch and TWS buds alongside its latest and greatest smartphones.

Redmi Watch 5

Redmi Watch 5 is the logical successor to last year’s Redmi Watch 4 and it brings a larger 2.07-inch AMOLED screen which now peaks at 1,500 nits. Xiaomi also trimmed the bezels and kept the 60Hz refresh rate.


Redmi Watch 5 key specs

Watch 5 features an aluminum frame and a metal dial on the right-hand side which allows you to navigate the UI. It’s one of the first wearables to launch with Xiaomi HyperOS 2 out of the box.

Xiaomi is also offering an eSIM version, which allows you to make calls and send out messages on supported platforms.

Xiaomi claims its new heart-rate tracking sensor offers 97.1% accuracy and you also get the standard blood oxygen, sleep and stress tracking. The watch also features a built-in GNSS positioning sensor and tracks your usual sports and activities.


Redmi Watch 5 eSIM edition

550mAh battery inside the Watch 5 is now rated at up to 24 days of normal usage and up to 12 days with Always-On Display mode.

Redmi Watch 5 comes in black and silver colors and is priced at CNY 599 ($82). The eSIM version comes in Titanium silver and is priced at CNY 799 ($110).

Redmi Buds 6 Pro

Redmi Buds 6 Pro come with 11 mm titanium-coated dynamic drivers which are paired with 6.7mm piezoelectric ceramic drivers.

Xiaomi also updated the active noise cancelation (ANC) which can drown out up to 55dB of noise. Buds 6 Pro pair over Bluetooth 5.3 and support LHDC 5.0 and LC3 audio codecs. Battery life from the buds and their case is rated at up to 36 hours.


Redmi Buds 6 Pro and Buds 6 Pro Gaming Edition

Xiaomi is also offering a Gaming Edition Buds 6 Pro, which features a 20ms latency and supports the LHDC Lossless audio codec via its specialized USB-C adapter.

Redmi Buds 6 Pro come in Jade Green, White and Black colors. Pricing is set at CNY 399 ($55). Buds 6 Pro Gaming Edition are priced at CNY 499 ($68).

Redmi Watch 5 • Redmi Buds 6 Pro (both in Chinese)
